    • Constructor Detail

      • Triangle

        public Triangle(double baseLength,
                double side1Length,
                double side2Length)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Main constructor for class Triangle. The constructor takes in the lengths of all three sides, creates a StraightLine object (with corresponding length) for each, and sets them equal to the instance variables.
        Parameters:
        baseLength - the length of the base
        side1Length - the length of side 1
        side2Length - the length of side 2
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • setNewMeasurements

        public void setNewMeasurements(double baseLength,
                               double side1Length,
                               double side2Length)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will create and store new measurements in the same fashion as the constructor based on the side lengths given.
        Parameters:
        baseLength - the length of the base
        side1Length - the length of side1
        side2Length - the length of side2
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if these sides cannot make a valid triangle

      • validateTriangle

        private static void validateTriangle(double side1,
                                     double side2,
                                     double side3)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This method checks if a valid triangle can be made from the given side lengths. A triangle cannot be made if one side is greater than or equal to the sum of the other two sides.
        Parameters:
        side1 - first side of the triangle
        side2 - second side of the triangle
        side3 - third side of the triangle
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a valid triangle cannot be made

      • computeTriangleCoordinates

        private static Vertex[] computeTriangleCoordinates(double baseLength,
                                                   double side1Length,
                                                   double side2Length)
        This method will compute the third vertex of the triangle when we assume that we know the two vertices of the base edge, which are (0,0) and (length of base, 0). This computation is done by using the three distance formulas for each side and solving for the x and y coordinate of the third vertex, with help from math.stackexchange.com. This method also simplifies the variables to ease the readability of the code. The base has vertices 'A' and 'B' and the vertex 'C' is the coordinate we are solving for. Base = line AB, side1 = line AC, side2 = line BC.
        Parameters:
        baseLength - baselength
        side1Length - side 1 length
        side2Length - side 2 length

      • drawTriangle

        public void drawTriangle(java.awt.Graphics g,
                         int centerX,
                         int centerY)
        This method uses the "drawStraightLine()" method in each edge of the triangle to draw the built triangle using swing GUI paintComponent method. The method first calls the compute coordinates method to make sure each StraightLine has the correct coordinates.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics awt object
        centerX - the center x-coordinate of the JPanel
        centerY - the center y-coordinate of the JPanel
